conclusion: To determine whether the particle is undergoing acceleration or deceleration based on the graph provided, we need to analyze the relationship between the reciprocal of velocity (1/v) and displacement (x).
The graph shows 1/v (reciprocal of velocity) plotted against displacement x. The graph is a straight line that increases linearly with x, starting from the origin O.
The reciprocal of velocity (1/v) is inversely proportional to velocity (v): v = 1/(1/v).
As 1/v increases, the velocity v decreases.
From the graph, 1/v increases linearly with x, implying that as the particle moves along the displacement x, its velocity v decreases.
If the velocity v decreases as the particle moves, the particle is undergoing deceleration.
The graph is linear, indicating a uniform rate of change of 1/v with respect to x, suggesting that the deceleration is uniform.
